Dispute_Type: Civil dispute over intellectual property rights
Legal_Issue: Whether H&R Block infringed U&R Tax Services' copyright by copying their 1988 T1 General Draft Form
Evidence_Assessment: The court assessed evidence regarding originality of the draft form and H&R's access to it
Decision_Outcome: In favor of U&R Tax Services
Burden_of_Proof: On U&R Tax Services to prove originality and infringement

Legal_Rule: Copyright subsists in original literary works; infringement occurs when a substantial part is copied without consent
Procedural_Issue: None identified; case proceeded on merits
Grounds_for_Claim: Unauthorized reproduction of a substantial part of a copyrighted work
Outcome_on_Merits: U&R succeeded on the merits of the copyright claim
Decision_Maker: Federal Court of Canada, Trial Division
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Not applicable; this was a trial decision
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proceedings were conducted fairly with opportunity for both parties to present evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Originality of U&R’s draft form, timing of creation, H&R’s access and photocopying, minor modifications made
Legal_Framework: Canadian Copyright Act framework for original works and infringement
Applicant_Challenge: U&R challenged H&R’s unauthorized use of their draft tax form
Court_Result: Awarded $145,010 in damages to U&R; dismissed H&R's counterclaim
Legal_Rule_Source: Copyright Act, R.S.C. 1985, c. C-42, s. 5(1)
Defendant_Response: H&R denied liability and filed a counterclaim (which was dismissed)
